broadwick.statistics.distributions

Class IntegerDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • broadwick.statistics.distributions.IntegerDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class IntegerDistribution
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A simple class for defining custom distributions. This is, in effect, a histogram.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init(int nbins)
        Add a number of entries (keys) to the histogram (with zero value).
        Parameters:
        nbins - the number of bins to add.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear all the data from the distribution, after this method the distribution has no denominator or frequency.

      • reset

        public final void reset(int val)
        Resets the value in each bin.
        Parameters:
        val - the reset value.

        public final void reset()
        Resets the value in each bin.

        Adds the content of the argument to the current object.
        Parameters:
        hist - the histogram data to add.

        the number of bins.

        Increment the size of a bin.
        Parameters:

                               Integer data)
        Set the value of a bin.
        Parameters:
        bin - the bin.
        data - the data.

      • getFrequency

        public final Integer getFrequency(Integer bin)
        Get the size of the histogram at the given bin.
        Parameters:
        bin - the bin.
        Returns:
        the size of the bin, or null if the bin is not in the histogram.

      • getData

        public final Integer getData(Integer bin)
        Deprecated. use getFrequency() instead
        Get the size of the histogram at the given bin.
        Parameters:
        bin - the bin.
        Returns:
        the size of the bin, or null if the bin is not in the histogram.

      • getRandomBin

        public final Integer getRandomBin()
        Select a random bin from the cumulative distribution of the histograms contents.
        Returns:
        the index of the random bin, or zero if no bin could be selected.

      • getRandomBinFrequency

        public final Integer getRandomBinFrequency()
        Select a random bin from the cumulative distribution of the frequencies and return the frequency.
        Returns:
        the contents of the randomly selected bin.

      • copy

        public final IntegerDistribution copy()
        Creates a copy of this histogram and returns it. The returned IntegerDistribution is a completely different object.
        Returns:
        a copy of this histogram.

      • getSumCounts

        public final Integer getSumCounts()
        Get the sum of the counts in the histogram.
        Returns:
        the sum of all the bins in the histogram.

      • getBins

        public final Collection<Integer> getBins()
        Get the bins in the histogram. The bins are the keySet of the underlying map object.
        Returns:
        the number of bins.

      • getBinContents

        public final Collection<Integer> getBinContents()
        Get a collection of the values held in the histogram. The bins are the keySet of the underlying map object, the values are the contents if the bin.
        Returns:
        a collection of the values held in the histogram.

      • size

        public final int size()
        Get the size (the number of bins) in the histogram.
        Returns:
        the size

      • toArray

        public final int[] toArray()
        Get an array of the bin values.
        Returns:
        an array of int values.

      • toLongArray

        public final long[] toLongArray()
        Get an array of the bin values.
        Returns:
        an array of long values.

      • scaleBins

        public final IntegerDistribution scaleBins(double factor)
        Scale the values in the histogram by a given factor. A copy of the histogram is returned, the original is not modified.
        Parameters:
        factor - the value by which every value in the hiistogram will be multiplied.
        Returns:
        the scaled histogram.

      • normaliseBins

        public final IntegerDistribution normaliseBins(int constant)
        Normalise the frequency distribution. The returned histogram is a scaled copy of the input histogram so that the sum of the returned histogram is equal to the normalising factor.
        Parameters:
        constant - the normalising constant
        Returns:
        the scaled and normalised histogram.

      • toString

        public final String toString()
        Get a string representation of the histogram.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        the string.

      • toCsv

        public final String toCsv()
        Get a string representation of the histogram in a csv format.
        Returns:
        the string.
